Disease.content:
Please identify the "Disease" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: RAD001 , an oral inhibitor of the mammalian target of rapamycin ( mTOR ) , has shown phase I efficacy in NSCLC .

Let's think step by step.

| Disease |
| --- |
| NSCLC (Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer) |

Explanation:

* NSCLC (Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer) is the disease entity mentioned in the paragraph. It is a type of lung cancer and is the focus of the study involving the drug RAD001.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Disease" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Disease |
| --- |
| NSCLC (Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer) |

Chemical.content:
Please identify the "Chemical" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Chemical". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: RAD001 , an oral inhibitor of the mammalian target of rapamycin ( mTOR ) , has shown phase I efficacy in NSCLC .

Let's think step by step.

| Chemical |
| --- |
| RAD001 |
| mammalian target of rapamycin (mTOR) |

In the given paragraph, the two chemical entities are:

1. RAD001: This is an oral inhibitor of the mammalian target of rapamycin (mTOR).
2. mammalian target of rapamycin (mTOR): This is a protein that plays a key role in cell growth, proliferation, and survival. It is the target of the drug RAD001 in this context.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Chemical" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Chemical".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Chemical |
| --- |
| RAD001 |

In the given paragraph, the only chemical entity that is clearly referred to is:

1. RAD001: This is an oral inhibitor of the mammalian target of rapamycin (mTOR).

The other entity, mammalian target of rapamycin (mTOR), is a protein and not a chemical. Therefore, it is not included in the table.
